evidence.pdf_reference: was carried out on an HP 5973 gas chromatographymass spectrometer (GC-MS). Typically, to investigate the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction performance for the catalysts, CdS or AgCdS (5 mg), H 2 O (4 mL), and TEOA (2 mL) were added into a Schlenk flask reactor (80 mL).Then pure CO 2 was introduced to the reactor with a partial pressure of 1.0 atm.A 300 W Xe lamp with a 420 nm cutoff filter was used as the light source.During the photocatalytic reaction, the reaction solution was vigorously stirred with a

(VB) over CdS, respectively.The photo-generated carriers migrate to the surface of CdS, the holes oxidize the TEOA, and the electrons reduce protons or CO 2 to produce H 2 or CO.When Ag nanoparticles as cocatalysts are deposited on the surface of CdS, thus forming abundant intimate contact between CdS and Ag, which will play some important roles in the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction.On one hand, such intimate contact can improve the separation of the photoexcited electrons and holes; On the other hand, Ag

identical conditions, only H 2 gas was detected, without any CO production.Furthermore, a 13 C-labeled isotropic experiment by using 13 CO 2 in place of 12 CO 2 , and the CO produced then analyzed by GC-MS.The result (Fig. S1) shows that, 13 CO (mz 29) is detected when 13 CO 2 is the reactant.All these results undoubtedly confirm that CO produced is derived from the CO 2 reactant.The stability is very important for practical photocatalytic system, thus the stability test over 1.0 wt. AgCdS was carried

of CO 2 -to-CO.The highest photocatalytic activity is achieved over 1.0 wt. AgCdS, with an increase by 3 times in comparison to CdS.In this reaction system, Ag can serve as electron trap as well as active site for CO 2 reduction, which is probably responsible for the enhanced activity and selectivity of CO 2 to CO over AgCdS.The possible mechanism of CO 2 photoreduction over AgCdS was proposed in view of the abovementioned analysis.
holes; On the other hand, Ag nanoparticles can act as active catalysts for CO 2 reduction.As a result, an enhanced photocatalytic CO 2 reduction performance is achieved over AgCdS.

CdS for AgCdS is 0.5, 1.0, 3.0, or 5.0 wt.) was added into the mixture, then it was irradiated under visible light ( 420 nm) for one hour.The mixture was filtered and the solids were cleaned with D.I. water.Finally, the obtained AgCdS was dried in a vacuum oven at 60 C overnight.The value for the actual Ag loading of the synthesized catalysts obtained by using inductively coupled plasma mass spectrum (ICP-MS), which is summarized in Table 1. Powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) was collected on a Bruker D8

was collected on a Bruker D8 Advance instrument (Cu Ka1 irradiation, 1.5406A).Scanning electron microscope (SEM) images were taken on a field emission scanning electron microscope (Hitachi, SU8010).Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) images were obtained on a FEI Tencai 20 microscope.X-ray photoelectron spectra (XPS) were collected on a PHI Quantum 2000 XPS system with the C1s peak (284.6 eV) as a reference.UV-vis diffuse reflectance spectra (DRS) was measured on a Varian Cary 500 Scan, with BaSO 4 as a

mixed solutions (volume ratio of H 2 O to TEOA 5:1), the resultant lower activity could be explained by the poor chemical affinity of water toward CO 2 molecules 37. To reveal the reasons for the enhanced photocatalytic CO 2 reduction performance over AgCdS, its behaviors of photogenerated-carriers were investigated.The dynamic behavior of the charge carriers was monitored by measuring open circuit potential (OCP) decay in a typical three-electrode cell 49 (see the Supporting Information for details).As

loading of Ag could be ascribed to the light blocking effect. The control experiments were also carried out and the results are summarized in Table S1.No products were detected when the reaction was performed in the dark, without catalyst or without TEOA, suggesting that the CO 2 -to-CO conversion reaction is proceeded by photocatalysis.In order to confirm the involvement of CO 2 in the reaction, we replaced CO 2 with high purity Ar atmosphere.After reaction under otherwise identical conditions, only H 2

over 1.0 wt. AgCdS was carried out.The results (Fig. S2) show that, during the cyclic runs, hydrogen production has a slight decrease in three subsequent runs, but CO evolution is very stable in the four runs.It has been reported that the photocatalytic activity and CO selectivity are significantly influenced by reaction media in the photoctalytic CO 2 reduction system.Thus we also investigated the effect of the volumetric ratio of H 2 OTEOA on the catalytic performance over AgCdS photocataysts.As
